@description.name: @description
@description.body:
*****************************************************************

qooxdoo - the new era of web development http://qooxdoo.org Copyright: 2004-2008 1&1 Internet AG, Germany, http://www.1und1.de License: MIT: https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT See the LICENSE file in the project's top-level directory for details. Authors: Fabian Jakobs (fjakobs) Sebastian Werner (wpbasti) Andreas Ecker (ecker) Derrell Lipman (derrell) Christian Hagendorn (chrisschmidt) Daniel Wagner (dwagner) *

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The Tree class implements a tree widget, with collapsible and expandable container nodes and terminal leaf nodes. You instantiate a Tree object and then assign the tree a root folder using the {@link #root} property. If you don't want to show the root item, you can hide it with the {@link #hideRoot} property. The handling of selections within a tree is somewhat distributed between the root tree object and the attached {@link qx.ui.tree.selection.SelectionManager}. To get the currently selected element of a tree use the tree {@link #getSelection} method and tree {@link #setSelection} to set it. The TreeSelectionManager handles more coarse-grained issues like providing {@link #selectAll} and {@link #resetSelection} methods.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This event is fired after a tree item was added to the tree. The {@link qx.event.type.Data#getData} method of the event returns the added item.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This event is fired after a tree item has been removed from the tree. The {@link qx.event.type.Data#getData} method of the event returns the removed item.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Control whether tap or double tap should open or close the tapped folder.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The root tree item of the tree to display

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Hide the root (Tree) node. This differs from the visibility property in that this property hides only the root node, not the node's children.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the Root should have an open/close button. This may also be used in conjunction with the hideNode property to provide for virtual root nodes. In the latter case, be very sure that the virtual root nodes are expanded programmatically, since there will be no open/close button for the user to open them.

@type.name: @type
@type.body: {Class} Pointer to the selection manager to use

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the widget, which contains the root tree item. This widget must have a vertical box layout.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: property apply

@description.name: @description
@description.body: property apply

@description.name: @description
@description.body: property apply

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the element, to which the content padding should be applied.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the tree item following the given item in the tree hierarchy.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: treeItem {qx.ui.tree.core.AbstractTreeItem} The tree item to get the item after
@param.description: The tree item to get the item after

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
invisible {Boolean?true} Whether invisible/closed tree items
     should be returned as well.
@param.description:
Whether invisible/closed tree items
     should be returned as well.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.ui.tree.core.AbstractTreeItem?null} The item after the given item. May be null if the item is the last item.
@return.description: The item after the given item. May be null if the item is the last item.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the tree item preceding the given item in the tree hierarchy.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: treeItem {qx.ui.tree.core.AbstractTreeItem} The tree item to get the item before
@param.description: The tree item to get the item before

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
invisible {Boolean?true} Whether invisible/closed tree items
     should be returned as well.
@param.description:
Whether invisible/closed tree items
     should be returned as well.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.ui.tree.core.AbstractTreeItem?null} The item before the given item. May be null if the given item is the tree's root.
@return.description: The item before the given item. May be null if the given item is the tree's root.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the tree item's next sibling.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
treeItem {qx.ui.tree.core.AbstractTreeItem} The tree item to get the following
 sibling of.
@param.description:
The tree item to get the following
 sibling of.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.ui.tree.core.AbstractTreeItem?null} The item following the given item. May be null if the given item is the last in it's nesting level.
@return.description: The item following the given item. May be null if the given item is the last in it's nesting level.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the tree item's previous sibling.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
treeItem {qx.ui.tree.core.AbstractTreeItem} The tree item to get the previous
 sibling of.
@param.description:
The tree item to get the previous
 sibling of.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.ui.tree.core.AbstractTreeItem?null} The item preceding the given item. May be null if the given item is the first in it's nesting level.
@return.description: The item preceding the given item. May be null if the given item is the first in it's nesting level.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns all children of the tree.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
recursive {Boolean ? false} whether children of subfolder should be
     included
@param.description:
whether children of subfolder should be
     included

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
invisible {Boolean ? true} whether invisible children should be
     included
@param.description:
whether invisible children should be
     included

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the tree's only "external" child, namely the root node.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the tree item, which contains the given widget.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
widget {qx.ui.core.Widget} The widget to get the containing tree
   item for.
@param.description:
The widget to get the containing tree
   item for.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.ui.tree.core.AbstractTreeItem|null} The tree item containing the widget. If the widget is not inside of any tree item null is returned.
@return.description: The tree item containing the widget. If the widget is not inside of any tree item null is returned.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: property apply

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Event handler for tap events, which could change a tree item's open state.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Event handler for changeSelection events, which opens all parent folders of the selected folders.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Event handler for key press events. Open and close the current selected item on key left and right press. Jump to parent on key left if already closed.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Adds the given item to the existing selection.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} if the item is not a child element.
@throws.description: if the item is not a child element.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Removes the given item from the selection. Use {@link qx.ui.core.ISingleSelection#resetSelection} when you want to clear the whole selection at once.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} if the item is not a child element.
@throws.description: if the item is not a child element.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns an array of currently selected items. Note: The result is only a set of selected items, so the order can differ from the sequence in which the items were added.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Replaces current selection with the given items.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} if the item is not a child element.
@throws.description: if the item is not a child element.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Detects whether the given item is currently selected.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} if the item is not a child element.
@throws.description: if the item is not a child element.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the selection is empty.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns all elements which are selectable.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
all {Boolean} true for all selectables, false for the
   selectables the user can interactively select
@param.description:
true for all selectables, false for the
   selectables the user can interactively select

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Tries to set the selection using the given array containing the representative models for the selectables.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns an array of the selected models.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Array} An array containing the models of the currently selected
   items.
@return.description:
An array containing the models of the currently selected
   items.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the field model value. Should also update the UI.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: value {var|null} Updates the field with the new model value.
@param.description: Updates the field with the new model value.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{null|Error} Should return an error when the type of
  model value is not compatible with the implementing class (the concrete field).
@return.description:
Should return an error when the type of
  model value is not compatible with the implementing class (the concrete field).

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns a consistent and up-to-date model value. Note: returned value can also be a promise of type Promise<*|null>.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {var|null} The model value plain or as promise.
@return.description: The model value plain or as promise.
